content.description: On the Nugget Boulder, on the approach to the Patio Area. SDS at the left side of the boulder. Traverse the crack yo right hand micro then make a long deadpoint. Pop to the jug and mantle.
Stand start left of Kamikaze on edges in a seam crack.  Head out to the lip with some non-intuitive foot beta and a committing crux.
content.location: left of Patio Roof, starts on chalked, sloping edges deeper into the cave.

content.description: The line next to the v6 on the small boulder right of Liza M. Corner
content.location: Sit start under a bulge and pull bad slopers to an obvious jug

content.description: Start all the way low and to the left of the big crack. Traverse slightly up and right all the way around to the top of Standard of Excellence.
content.location: Found on the Standard Traverse boulder

content.description: Sit-start on the edge and the arete and climb up and top out on the arete.
content.location: Around the corner from the main Standard Traverse line.

content.description: Find a boulder that looks like a sail from a boat. Start low on two incut jugs and crimp your way up using the arete and face holds to the tallest point of the sail.
content.location: Uphill from the upper terrace boulder.

content.description: Climb Patio Roof, but instead of exiting left via the lip traverse, tackle the challenging mantle directly up to top out.
SDS at the back of the roof on juggy sidepulls, climb up and out the roof.  At the lip, travers left to bigger holds and mantle

Lay down start with hands and left heel on lower lip.  Make a big move out to the lip with the right hand.  Work your way up and left up the arête fighting the barn-door.  Hoof it up the slab.  Great texture and movement, a bit burly.  Good pebble wrestling here.
content.location: just to the right of Patio Roof

content.description: Upper Terrace - SDS on two obvious incurs on the right side of a large crack. Climb the overhanging arête via powerful moves, roll the lip.
content.protection: Two pad or more. Back cracker landing.

content.description: One of the best at Rumbling Bald! Start same as Patio Roof, but cross your right hand over your body to the crimp in the roof and climb out and left through a sidepull/undercling feature, with the business culminating in a crazy fun dyno to the good hold at the lip.
content.protection: Standard Patio Roof gym floor set-up
content.location: The obvious roof at the lowest level of the Terraces

content.description: Start the same as Dreamland but match the first crimp  and go left into the Terrace Crack. It feels kind of low but it actually climbs pretty well.
content.location: Same as Dreamland. The boulder just above Patio Roof.

content.description: Start matched on a crimp on the arete, make a long move out left to a crimp, wrestle slopers, pinches, and jugs out the steep prow to the lip. Slap the sloper over the lip, and traverse hard left to the crack before mantling over.
content.protection: Multiple pads to cover the rocks in the oddly angled landing. All falls are safe if padded correctly.
content.location: On the upper Terrace above Patio Roof. Starts in the pit on the left side of the huge crack between the two boulders (the right boulder on other side of crack is off).

content.description: Climb Kamikaze to the jump move, one arm cut on the jug for brownie points and style. Traverse right on the slopey rail and top patio roof direct's mantle.
Sit-start left of The Sail on good flakes, then crimp small edges straight up the face aiming for a rounded, incut ledge slightly left of the start.
